# The `MCSectionELF` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This represents a section on linux, lots of unix variants and some bare metal systems. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MCSectionELF</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This represents a section on linux, lots of unix variants and some bare metal systems.

Definition at line 27 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcsectionelf-h">MCSectionELF.h</a>.

### EntrySize {#a121186015c6be808a8ff0bd0d97dc748}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::MCSectionELF::EntrySize">
The size of each entry in this section.

This size only makes sense for sections that contain fixed-sized entries. If a section does not contain fixed-sized entries &#39;EntrySize&#39; will be 0.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcsectionelf-h/#l00039">39</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcsectionelf-h">MCSectionELF.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LinkedToSym {#a97a934ecbe19ec1d8d9ed59a492664e7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const MCSymbol&#42; llvm::MCSectionELF::LinkedToSym</>}>
Used by SHF&#95;LINK&#95;ORDER.

If non-null, the sh&#95;link field will be set to the section header index of the section where LinkedToSym is defined.
